One of those times where theoretically you've had a week to write your essay but literally can't find the time inbetween labwork and gym. And every time you try and write it you keep going nononono rewrite! Make sense! *insert pretty diagrams* 

Dude, I've got to be up at 5.30am anyway, I might as well keep going! I have however consumed industrial quantities of tea. Mmmm tea.

I just had the best bowl of tofu miso soup in the world ever.  

Sari's godly tofu miso soup:

2 1/2 cups boiling water
1 1/2 sachets miso soup mix
2 tsp chicken stock mix (or to preferred taste) 
4 spring onions, chopped
handful coriander leaves 
romaine/cos lettuce leaves chopped or leafy stuff of your choice 
as much tofu as you want to eat 

Boil all together for about 5 min. Serve. Eat. 

(note: this is seriously-hungry-me size.)

I have also just consumed half a kilo of tofu. o_0
*full now* 
Training food, much?

In other news.... Having got back from places afar, I have a really rather silly amount of random bits of cheapo knockoff anime goods floating around. Mostly on the large-sheets-of-stickers front. I am clearly never going to use any of these except to ogle, but I'm sure I can find a better home for them, namely with some of You. So... I have stuff from the following fandoms available: 1. Prince of Tennis - loads of all-character sticker sheets - mini and A3 2. Naruto - loads of A3 and mini sticker sheets, plus a few characters, and poster-y A3 stickers 3. Saiyuki - loads of A3 sticker sheets 4. Angel Sanctuary/Ruroni Kenshin - 1 poster-y A3 sheet of each Plus I was clearing out my room and I seem to have Gundam Wing Region 1 DVDs 1-3 - I was sort of keeping them in case I ever wanted to AMV them, but can't see myself doing so in the forseeable future - I was thinking of Ebaying them, but does anyone desperately want these? So basically, send me a list of your - fandoms from the above - any particular character preferences/chibis - postal address to sarinthesky @ hotmail, and I'll put together a few sheets and post them to you!

I have had a productive few days. I have learnt:

1. Laptop woes #2: When someone says that they'll configure your ip address to work on the system, make sure they're not changing so many settings it takes you 3 hours to find what they did when your computer refuses to recognise Any internet Anywhere... (detect ip address setting your friend...)

2. I am a walking disaster area waiting to happen in Step Class. Fear me and my amazing ability to fall off steps not once but Multiple times!

3. Never ask "is there anything else you need doing in this experiment?" to your supervisor. They will say "yes" and double the amount of work you have to do. Haha.

OMG had minor computer related heart attack today. I took my laptop in to be configured for the lab network. I gave it to Mr Techie guy who said no problems he'll get it done right away. Two hours later I head back expecting to find nice configured laptop. Instead, a ghost reformatter was running. "Oh" says he. "You were running XP home not XP network, so I'm making a copy of your system and reformatting it to XPNetwork." "Will everything run the same?" asks I. "Oh yes" says he. "Mostly." "MOSTLY?"I query. "Oh yes, mostly." Says he. "You might have to reinstall a few of your programs but all your files will be there." (Note at this point: ALL my program cds/backup files are in ENGLAND. Which is very far from AUSTRALIA as the crow flies or more relevantly, the CD Doesn't. ) I quote from my notebook: AAAARGH He's Reconfiguring my laptop to XPNetwork And I'm going to have to reinstall ALL MY PROGRAMS AAARGH!!!! They're BACK IN ENGLAND AAAARGH!! If I can't get adobe premiere pro 1.5 back I will cry. WAAAAAAGH> My Adobe Premiere Pro install is a rip and Not Re-gettable by anything remotely easy. And my AMV bunnies are just returning! I proceed at this point to have a major internal wibble attack. LUCKILY I go back. Apparently because I've just downloaded about 10 gigs of Bleach, by hard drive didn't have enough space to take the reformat, and it's back to normal. So I have my photoshop. I have my 238473 different programs of which only about half work and the other half I have to toggle with to get to work but IT DOESN'T MATTER. I HAVE MY LAPTOP BACK!! What is that saying? "You only know what you really have when it is threatened to be taken away from you" or something. SOTRUE. *Gives my laptop SoMuchLove*

Very sorry to keep spamming about Bleach. Very good fun. A little...formulaic?

<lj-cut text="Sari's guide to being a Bleach Good Guy">

Sari's guide to being a Bleach Character:

1.  Find an excuse to have a big ass fight with Bad Guy. 
2.  Don't stop to talk and work out why you might be fighting. Talking it out is for wusses and people without big ass swords to do the arguing. Just jump right in the moment someone you don't recognise turns up. (Insult them for extra points.)
3.  Have big ass fight. 
4.  Have Bad guy tells you how many times more powerful he is than you.
5.  Get mortally wounded. 
6.  Bleed A Lot.
7.  Have Bad Guy taunt you a bit. And leave you just alive for (insert <strike>lame excuse</strike> purposes of continuing storyline here). 
8.  Un-mortally wound self (tip: find handy Squad 4-er, or have spiritual experience with sword). 
9.  Find handy trainer (look for ex-Shinigami with mysterious past).
10. Get handy trainer to set you a training program that's so tough you might die.
11. Almost die.
12. Have angst. (Think about friends/family/Rukia and how you have to save them because they're all depending on you etc.)
13. Go RAAAARGH. 
14. Glow a bit.
15. Get new sword. 
16. Shake yo' ass.
17. Pass training faster than anyone else has EVAR (get bonus points for every person commenting on this)
18. Challenge the guy who beat you last
19. Almost die again
20. Pull out new and improved attack. 
21. Strike a pose.
22. Look shocked as evil opponent pull out even better attack whilst boasting how many times more powerful he still is than you.
23. Almost die (for Real this time, honestly...)
24. Have angst. (See above. Add in flashback of your I-almost-died-training). 
25. Pull out even-specialler-than-you attack
26. Have random bystander and/or opponent comment on how many times more powerful you are than last time. 
27. Go RAARGH.
28. Glow a bit.
29. Win
30. Leave opponent to have a character moment/look incredulous at your new uber power/angst
31. Hawk up a bit of blood for effect.
32. Walk away to angst on about above friend/family/Rukia
33. Have comical interaction with side character
34. Insert filler
35. Find new Ultimate Opponent.
36. Rinse. Repeat.
</lj-cut>

Also: scenes you seldomly see in Bleach #1:

Guy 1: I Will Kill You!
Guy 2: Wait a minute, why are you going to kill me?
Guy 1: Because you oppose what I want to do. Which is xxxxxx
Guy 2: Ohhhh because I'm opposing you for exactly the same reason. We're not enemies! 
Guy 1: Ah! Isn't it good we worked that out before resorting to trying to kill one another!
Guy 1&2: *skip off into the distance holding  hands*

So, I just finished 'I Capture the Castle' by Dodie Smith. (Ahem...revision...ahem...)
<lj-cut text="Has anyone else read it?Majorly spoilery">

I...liked it. I really liked the understanding and change and development of Cassandra throughout the book. I loved the descriptions and points of view on trying to capture a moment - allegories to religious experience, love etc. I loved the character of the genius/barmy father. I loved the depiction of the flawed but sympathetic rose. I loved the little moments in it that just...speak to you.  I'm not so sure about the depiction of tru wuv - maybe I get irrationally irritated by stories where there's a first one true love and it means everything by the end of the book it's still the one true love and nothing else can change it. I guess, the description, of being in love, great, but I also feel that you can be in love, and then fall out of it, and life goes on, and it's not over because the one true love is.  But also, I can see why it's written like that, because there were so many moments with Cassandra and Simon where you were like they'd be so good together - their mutual love of poetry etc. 

but DAMN Stephen!!!!! My heart goes out completely and utterly to Stephen and I just couldn't bear it for the way things go for him. The wireless...the way everything he was doing was for her... And the irony, of how Cassandra is treating Stephen, when she doesn't love him, and how Simon is treating her, as far as I read into the book. About the cruelty of giving someone false hope, allowing them to fall even more for you, making it even more painful for them in the long run. 

I don't know, maybe Simon will get over Rose and happy ever after. Maybe Cassandra will get over Simon and live happily ever after. But I love the bit in it where she says happily ever after is like hitting a brick wall, like the characters die at that point. Word. I remember someone saying somewhere - there's no such thing as happy endings. Endings happen when someone dies, or you fall apart, and are almost always painful. And that all we have are happy middles, and to enjoy those bits, for that's what we are given. Also the irony, how in the beginning when they were poor, you could say there was a naive happiness to it both from Stephen and Cassandra, and it's only with the coming of the Cottons that there are moments of joy, but also much more grief and melancholy. The 'coming of age' from Cassandra - knowing this would be her last midsummer eve, and the mannequin in her room, was all quite bittersweet too. 

I did however absolutely adore the descriptions of the castle. Transported you there.   It's funny - it's one of those books that everyone seems to have read, and despite me reading almost anything I got my hands on, I seem to have missed out on. Like 'What Katy Did', or 'Black Beauty' or 'Great Expectations' I've nevre got round to reading. Admittedly most of my reading was from the books around our house, and my parents reading taste you could call...eclectic...(choice between crossword puzzle books or trashy scifi...) but there we go. Very glad I read it.

Merry Crimbo/Happy Hols/Happy coming New Year to all of you! Have just returned from the deepest depths of the family back to work and intarweb access. Lj skip=500? o_0 Apologies if I don't get round to reading everyone's entries. So my friend and I were discussing my theorem that pie can be used as an allegory in almost any situation. Friend: No way. I mean, there's only so much pie can do. It doesn't have like, emotions, or complexity. Me: Ok, think of a situation. Friend: How about, erm, going to work? Pie isn't like going to work because work sucks 90% of the time. Me: Yes, but so does cooking pie. It takes hours of preparing, and rolling dough and waiting for it to bake. However in the end, we all cook pie because the rewards are worth it in the end. Friend: Ok I'll concede that. How about...hmmmm... Men. Because like, pie is always good, and reliably enjoyable. But not complex. Me:Ah, but you see, choosing men is like choosing pie. You go around looking at different pies, perhaps tasting a few, and like, you're always looking for certain characteristics - like crispiness of crust, or gravy. Though you have to consider whether you can afford them. Friend: Ah true. And like, you could go on trying pies for ever, looking for the perfect pie, and never buy one. Me: Exactly, because either like, the shops will shut, or someone else will go and buy the pie you liked but didn't buy because you thought you might like a better one. Friend: Yup, and in the end, you've just got to say "I like this pie. It may not have the crispiest crust, or quite enough gravy, but damn it in the end I'm happy with this pie, and though there may be tastier, more perfect pies in the world, I'm making the decision to buy this pie." Me: Or alternatively you could just buy all the pies. Though you might be sick if you ate them all at once. And they might get jealous of one another. Friend: You are right. The world can indeed be described in terms of pie.

Tagged by <lj user="elyndys">! :D Write about five weird/quirky habits you have, then tag five more people to do the same.

1. I have an irrational dislike of having to wear socks. I always try and wear sock-less shoes for as long as I can into the winter, solely so I don't have to go fish out a pair of socks to wear them with.

2. I haven't slept on a mattress for about 3 years now - I had a time when I had back problems, so I shifted to sleeping on the floor which was much much better. Have since compromised with a futon.

3. On the subject, I can sleep Absolutely Anywhere. Including in a bath, on top of a garden table and once when we were camping and our tent blew down and it was raining and fitting 5 people in a car to sleep doesn't really work unless someone sleeps in a ball in the boot. 

4. I have to read books all the way through once I start them - everything else takes second place until I've finished the damn thing!

5. I'm an absolute serial doodler - it is physically impossible for me to hold a pen without drawing on something, including myself. 

tagging:
<lj user="trinityhelix">, <lj user="anhera">, <lj user="turnip_girl">, <lj user="thomasvye"> and <lj user="tessith"> and anyone who feels like giving it a go!

Just went to see The Lion the Witch and the Wardrobe.

<lj-cut text="I'm such a dork">

It's funny how a film can bring back so many memories.

I'd totally forgotten reading the books - I knew obviously that I had, but couldn't remember when and how. It was only when watching the film that it started coming back. I remembered my pre-prep school, which was run by a group of stuck-in-the-70's 'progressive' hippy types who believed that children shouldn't be forced to do anything they didn't want to. Like for instance, learn to read. I remember being the only person in the entire class who could actually read words. I remember the only reason I got accepted at my prep school was because the book they gave me to read "The little red hen" was one I knew off by heart, so it looked like I could read fluently. And finally being given a kick up the arse by the school and learning how to read. 

I remember being given "The Lion, the Witch, and the Wardrobe" for Christmas in a big blue hardbound edition by my grandparents, when I was 7 years and 4 days, and it was the first book I ever read. God this is sounding like a pile of mush, but it was the book that really showed me to love reading. 

I think I've always had a totally overactive imagination. I always was, and still am, making up entire worlds, writing long stories in my head. And I remember reading that book, and it was a whole other world to explore. 

I guess the Narnia books, really, were the books of my childhood. To complete the schmaltz in the story I should probably say something about how they were my only friends when everyone else teased me at school or something, but that's total bollocks. I loved school and my friends. But I loved, and still love, the ability to go and live in different worlds, including those other people write, stepping in their shoes, just for a bit. I guess it's sort of a (to paraphrase) "This is my world, tell me yours" (sorry Manics) And I guess you have to be nostalgic about the first time you remember doing that, and how much of what you are has come from it all. 

So you know, I can accept they're not the most amazing works of literature ever, they shove christian allegory in your face (I must have been the only person age 18 to have still missed the Aslan/Jesus thing before someone told me), and the film yes, was incredibly cheesy and certainly had it's faults. But my word, did seeing affect me. It was the really random bits though - not the big weepy scenes or anything, but the first time we get a shot of Cair Paravel, meeting Father Christmas, Peter just about vomming after killing Morgrim, and trying his best to look after his siblings, and Aslan roaring as he takes off with Lucy and Susan on his back. Because it pretty much was the world I used to dream about, right there.

I've just finished a video short, sort of inspired by a conversation way back, debating if Naruto were to make his own Anime Music Video, what would it be? Title: The Konoha AMV Project Creator: Description: Konoha is holding a Music Video contest, and everyone has to decide what they're going to enter. Episode 1/? Put together in a couple of days and very very silly. Blame the crack... Conversation done in subtitles because (being english) otherwise everyone would end up sounding like either they're trying to do Shakespeare or my Worst Surfer-Dude voice ever. Episode 2 should be starring Kiba, Neji and Gaara, out err, when I finish it... Download links: Yousendit and Megaupload (apologies to friends if you're getting this more than once as crossposted)
Oh my god Hehehehehehheh. And I remember why I was a ToFu fangirl to start with... *can't wait to see if anything comes of it*

AMV crack... So, I was thinking, if the characters from Naruto had to make their own AMV, what would they do? Which sort of inspired the crack project of doomTM. Just finished the first render of it: The Konoha AMV Project For some reason adobe premiere decided to black out some of the clips randomly so will have to fix that, and a few other issues which didn't show up on the pre-render.

Argh *is having AMV angst* So yes, finally got back to the NejiProjectTM, and finished selecting clips, and just trying out a whole load of effects, because omg beautiful song so want to match that, except I've been playing around for so long now and it feels like they totally suck. *sends mwahs to and her Tachibanana* - I've got two 6 second clips of the sort of things, v low quality so small: Here and Here Hmmm... what do you think hon? Nyarg. And I keep getting most of my inspiration to work on the supersekritprojectofDoomTM...

Name 5 of life's simple pleasures that you like most, then pick 5 people to do the same. Try to be original and creative and not to use things that someone else has already used. Tag 5 people on your list. 1. Wearing slippers/sandals so that you don't have to spend time in the morning finding socks, and then not being able to find matching ones, and then having to scour the house for errant hosiery 2. The time in bed you get when you wake up naturally feeling good Before your alarm clock goes off 3. Singing Really Really loudly at the top of your voice when driving down the motorway in a car because No One can hear you 4. The really satisfying feeling when you've just done something like stub your toe and you shout F**K REALLY loudly 5. Having someone walk over your back when it's all uncomfy and hearing it go *pop* and then it's just sooooo nice.... tagging (if you haven't done it already) (sorry guys), , , , and anyone else who wants?

Went to saw Howl's Moving Castle yesterday.
Unintentionally turned up to the only showing of the subbed version all week.

Fear the power of my inner fangeek.

<lj-cut text ="Molesworth on criket"> 


There is only one thing in criket and that is the STRATE BAT. Keep yore bat strate boy and all will be all right in life as in criket. So headmasters sa, but when my bat is strate i still get bowled is that an omen chiz. Aktually i usually prefer to hav a slosh: i get bowled just the same but it is more satisfactory.

For the reason that it is extremely dificult to hit the ball with a STRATE BAT or not criket matches are a bit of a strane. When you are a new bug or a junior in the 3rd game it is all right becos then you can sit around the boundary and keep the score in a notebook. When you get tired with that which is about 3 minits you can begin to tuough up your frendes and neighbours who look so sweet and angelic in their clean white criket shirts hem-hem. This is super. You look up enuff to sa Good shot, grabber or Couldn't hit a squashed tomato, and then back to the fray.

But it is a funy thing when you grow biger you always get into a criket team you canot avoid it chiz. Tremble tremble you arive and see the pitch which is 2388 miles approx from the pavilion. Captain win toss and choose to bat chiz chiz chiz chiz. Moan drone tremble tremble you sit with white face and with everybode's knees knocking together it sound like a coconut shy. Wot is the pleasure of it eh i would like to kno. Give me a thumbscrew or slo fire every time.

When your turn come the folowing things can hapen
(A) You loose your bat.
(B) You fante dead away.
(C) Your trousis fall down.
(D) You trip over your shoe laces.

Captain then come up to you and sa BLOCK EVERYTHING molesworth and do not slosh we need 6 to win. When he sa this all the things above hapen all at once. They revive you with a buket of water and drive you out to the wicket. This is not as you guessed 2398 miles away it is 6000 now and they hav men with gats covering all the exits so you canot run away.

At the wicket

Of course it is the fast blower you hav to face he is waiting there at the other end of the pitch looking very ferce. Umpire is v. kind he can aford to be he hav not got to bat. He sa
We are very pleesed to see you do make yourself at home. Of course you would like guard what guard would you like us to give you?
Squeak.
Come agane?
Squeak squeak.
i will give you centre hold your bat up strate to you a trifle now away again. That is centre. Your position is 120 miles NNE of beachy head you may come in and land. There are 5 balls to come. At the 5th pip it will be 4.2 precisely. Able Baker Out.

PLAY!
Fast blower retreat with the ball mutering and cursing. He stamp on the grass with his grate hary feet he beat his chest and give grate cry. Then with a trumpet of rage he charge towards you. Quake quake ground tremble birdseed fly in all directions if only you can run away but it is not done. Grit teeth close eyes. Ball hit your pads and everyone go mad.

OWSATSIR OW WASIT EHOUT!!
Umpire look for a long time he is bent double at last he lift one finger. 
He is a difrent man now from the kindly old gentleman who made you feel at home. His voice is harsh.
Out. No arguments. Get cracking. Take that xpression off your face. On course at 20000 feet return to base. Out.
Distance back to pavilion is now 120000 miles and all the juniors sa yar boo sucks couldn't hit a squashed tomato. It is no use saing you were not out by a mile team give you the treatment behind the pav just the same. There is only one consolation you can give it up when you grow up. Then you rustle the paper and sa Wot a shocking show by m.c.c. most deplorable a lot of rabits ect. ect. Well, you kno how they go on. Enuff.

Finally got round to downloading AMV Hell 3. OMG 1 hour +?

Some genius moments in there tho. <lj-cut text="Highlights:">
Sucks to be Shinji... awwww...Burn baby burn grave of fireflies so wrong...Kakashi lips omgwtf!... that eva/titanic one was genius....multikill!....HAHAHAHHAHA Fushigi Yuugi Nakago/Tamahome one just great..Shinji getting hit by football so simple... sappy self indulgence parody to Cardcaptor Sakura great!...Crazy froggelion...HAHAHAHAAHAHH OMG VEGETA IS WHITNEY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  Damn this one had me in tears...Pure pure gold.... Red vs Blue to FMA. (I love caboose....)...Akio sex machine class. HAHAHAAHAH SHINJI!!!!!! Phone teabagging helpline! Poor. Shinji. Dude, that one is so true....Gaara sandman...Hehehe euphoria parody, man, that must have taken almost as much time as doing one seriously...Bohemian star trek very good (I'm guessing it's a wield Al or something?)....Armstrong really is too sexy...and finally nice shounen bushido copy at the end, god, that must have taken bloody ages as well. </lj-cut>

But the MajinVegeta/Goku has to take the biscuit. 
Also I think you should get extra extra points for getting the Red Vs Blue one.  Meta geekdom....

In other news Adobe Premiere Pro is back again so hello Nejivid. (<lj user="trinityhelix"> hon, was going to send you a mini cookie for your b/day... can be a sort of errr yay you were born a week ago cookie?)

Just finished Advent Children. (<lj user="todokanai"> I love you to bits)

Whoah.

...


Ok I never even finished FF VII I have no idea about what is happening 90% of the time, but OMGWTFBBQTLA The Action!
In no particular order:

1. Cloud Very Pretty. Very very j-pop-idol-androgynous-pretty-boy pretty. So pretty he should have shoujo sparkles around his face and biiiiig shimmery eyes (oh wait...)

2. Tifa kicks somuch ass. Her fight with big tonk guy was just like Hell Yeah! 

3. Ahhh Clotis and Clorises are going to have a field day analysing this one...

4. Biggest surprise of the day that was So going to happen because you know, we all knew That fight was going to happen...

5. Turks rule. 

6. And again OMG the gravity-ignoring, physics-defying kevlar-skinned-my-sword-is-bigger-than-yours action. Just. Yeah.

still *_* with teh Pretty.


EDIT: Oooh and Yuuta's party at <lj user="downto2">! Atobe piratey goodness. Tezuka nonplussed very cute. Sengoku's love/love beams getting him into trouble, the image of Shinji unenthusiastically waving phallic objects cracks me up (but awww IbuKami!) Kaidoh is adorable and Inui is.... so so deliciously evil...  Akutsu/Dan fluff!!! and ahhh Syuusuke and Yuuta... *can't wait until Atobe's part-ay*

in phone booth in Torquay. Weather wonderful - like middle of summer. Am on boat sailing round cornwall with friends. We all smell and now are soaked because I refused to downsize the mainsail and the waves were coming in and crashing over our starboard bow "hahah take this puny wave" CRASH FWOOM it went, but much fun. Got 5p  credit left so hope everyone wonderful and hugs to those who are not. 
(Torquay is the sort of Blackpool of the sw coast. Every other shop sells mr whippys or boat trips. all great.) off to make stew. 
x

Haven't done one of these in a while, but assessments now over, and time aplenty for Narucrack! This episode brought to you by...Tenten! Soooo, when we last saw our heroes, there they were, with Hina stuck in a raging torrent towards a plunge to oblivion and the rest of the team captured by a giant bee... Oh no! . AAAAgh (big BIG fear of potholes and caving and Anything that involves going into small dark spaces with no light or air Why Do People Do This For fun?) (Except without like, the massive 500ft drop...) Yeeee, bugscomingoutofhisneck! *girly flap* Heheheh. Naruworm. Kiba, meanwhile, sleeps happily oblivious throughout... Even the Badguys are NaruHina shippers! Love how even though he looks like a glo-worm, Shino still manages to be calm and leader-like and oh so cooler-than-thou Errr....they don't, do they? Huh? (I thought bees made wax cells...maybe in the Narutoverse they have special hidden-hives which have coccoons which make little special bee-nin) (bee-nin would be awesome) Err, good timing mate *FACEGRIND* OOoh, Kyuubi!Face comes out... are we about to see some Naruto AssKicking? Nope, because Here She Comes to Save the DAAAAAY! (it means that mighty mouse Hinata, is on her waaaay!) (did anyone else watch that? Mighty mouse rocked. Though he did have a worrying tendency to try and sing opera whilst in the middle of day-saving...) . Comical Naruto-squiggling, and NewAndEmpowered!Hinata ShinoWorm! (Kiba still blissfully unaware) Aha! Hinata-dini managed to escape from the coccoon in the nick of time... And for her next trick... "I call this, interpretative dance on the imminent demise of a swarm of bees" . Oooh hello.... I am Hinata of Many Arms! (LOTR fans spot the misquote?) WHAM! Take that Nasty bee! SHTOOM! That's for always flying around picnics and making people flap and run away and spill the orange juice! FWUMP! That's for the pointy stinging thing you have in your backside that you use even if you have to commit bee-suicide in the process! BAM! That's for making incessant buzzing noises against windowpanes when the open window is Three Inches Away! Hinata's first fanboy! Ooooh, meow! Ahh the old flashback.... Kiba: *hums* "Gummi Bears...bouncing here and there and everywhere..." (I'm really overdosing on the 80's cartoons here eh?) . Ah, good stuff, that Hinata . Shino:*mutters* "geez... why do I always have to be the matchmaker...and why I have to spell it out to captain oblivious here?" Anyone wonder what the baddies are doing whilst all this is going on? I mean, they could be er...taking out Kiba? Thinking of a new attack? Fangirling Hinata! Aw, this is such a Hinata love episode! Yeah yeah yeah.... you had it *all* under control even when Hinata was about 3 feet away from being waterfall-puree.... . WHOM! Bee-chowder. . Awwww! . Hinata SoCute Kiba: Yeah, and this is my "SO THERE NYAAH" face You're just playing the pity card now... Ok, then how about my InsaneRevenge! Face? Oh No! It's the end of the filler episode and the big baddie needs defeating! Well, you can't beat the old faithful... . Job done! Now to give that Biko-whatsit Sasuke's headband to smell... OHFORGOODNESSSAKE. Running out of time... Must find... . Hinata:*searches* "hmmm...headband...headband...OOh Hello Naruto's ass...ahem...concentrate on job in hand..." There it is! Naruto, under the fallen trees! Naruto episode writing lesson #43: there's never a bad moment for toilet-humor. And the Biko-thingummy spent the rest of it's days happily following around Naruto's behind. The End. Naruto: WTF Sort of ending to a filler arc is that???? We spend three episodes finding this thing so you could finish it off with a fart joke??? . Inner Sakura becomes reality... . Hinata: (though Mission: Get some Naruto Lovin' got an A+ ^_^....) . OMG What have they done??? Hyuuga's smiling??? Hiashi: DAMMIT I have cold, hard exterior hiding a cold, hard interior, I Glare therefore I am! What have you done to meee? Neji: Dude, you got it easy. They made me *simper* Strawberries? Tea, vicar? Naruto? (blatantly) Episodes with me being generally awesome? Ahh, you wish, for next episode... Wahey Team Gai!

Heheheheh. I love the way there's an article on BBCNewsOnline about how the Sports Minister is saying that Footballers should behave more like cricketers, and the caption picture is of an absolutely bladdered Freddie Flintoff.

Genius.

Needless to say...

<font size="8"> ^____^ <font size="2">

England regain the Ashes.
Ohyes.

Flintoff sums it up: "The strength of this side is that people stick their hand up at different times"  whenever a performance was needed, there were enough outstanding and inspiring players that someone would stand up and be counted. Harmy and KP at Lords to show we weren't going to lie down. Tres and Freddie at Edgebaston, Jones and Vaughan at Old Trafford, Hoggy and Flintoff again at Trent Bridge, and Freddie and Hoggy and then of course KP at the Oval. Awesome.
